top_categories.workout_context: Croatan Buck Fifty’s 150-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Croatan Buck Fifty rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Croatan Buck Fifty’s croatan national forest gravel (90%), dirt roads (10%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Croatan Buck Fifty isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
At 150 miles, Croatan Buck Fifty rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Croatan Buck Fifty’s croatan national forest—flat coastal gravel, sandy terrain and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Croatan Buck Fifty. Make this intensity feel like home.
Every session at Croatan Buck Fifty intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Croatan Buck Fifty’s croatan national forest—flat coastal gravel, sandy terrain delivers on race day.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Croatan Buck Fifty when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Croatan Buck Fifty — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Tempo is the race-day intensity of Croatan Buck Fifty. Harder than Z2, easier than threshold — the pace you’ll hold for hours on croatan national forest—flat coastal gravel, sandy terrain.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 150 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 150 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Croatan Buck Fifty requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on croatan national forest—flat coastal gravel, sandy terrain to build confidence. Expect: croatan national forest gravel (90%), dirt roads (10%), flat coastal terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 150 miles of croatan national forest—flat coastal gravel, sandy terrain in New Bern, North Carolina (Croatan National Forest).
